stream_context.summary: Kaze imported and refined several new assets, fixed engine bugs, and prototyped a collapsing-platform set piece for the factory/airplane section of Course 11 while occasionally jumping to Course 4 for bug-testing. He also discussed outstanding animation work, remaining level count, and early marketing ideas.

development_findings.summary: The hack is roughly 75 % complete; nine levels remain before content lock.
Zeina must redo all penguin and Dory animations because the old GeoBone system was removed.
development_findings.quote: All the actors in this model are fucked up animation-wise because they still use the old GeoBone system.

development_findings.summary: Kaze replaced Nintendo’s duplicated GeoBone workaround with a proper fix, removing one matrix multiplication per actor.
development_findings.quote: Instead you should fix it properly to save on a whole matrix multiplication per actor.

development_findings.summary: A sound-engine bug lets a distant actor fix its position at the camera, playing full-volume audio; root cause still unknown.
development_findings.quote: Somehow it seems in the sound computation one actor can be so far away from the camera that it doesn’t update its position.

development_findings.summary: Mini N64 Object Exporter no longer outputs animation in the latest Blender; Kaze had to copy data manually.
development_findings.quote: Surely there’s a reason it’s broken—what did I do to Blender?

development_findings.summary: The new ‘cell guy’ NPC was imported, but Kaze prefers re-using the existing Shy Guy model for consistency.
development_findings.quote: Is it okay if I say I don’t like this and I’d rather you reuse your usual Shy Guy model?

development_findings.summary: Factory grates now collapse instantly when Mario is running, creating spectacle without raising difficulty.
development_findings.quote: I don’t want difficulty; I want excitement.

development_findings.summary: Plane minigame dust trail combiner was reverted to the older system after an underflow bug was found and fixed.
Missing airplane propeller texture recreated as 32×32 IA8; Kaze argued IA8 gives finer grayscale than IA4.
development_findings.quote: Why do you want 16 different levels of gray? IA8’s really good.

development_findings.summary: Warp hitboxes shrank after adding camera parameters to warp data; size logic was corrected.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy prioritises ‘excitement over difficulty’ and purposeful level design.
context_findings.quote: Your level design should have purpose… I don’t want difficulty; I want excitement.

context_findings.summary: He cut his own hair because barbers are ‘time inefficient’.
Discovering his old mouse had 40 ms of input lag changed his view on hardware quality.
context_findings.quote: My mouse was the reason I was completely unable to play shooter games.

context_findings.summary: Plans to announce an original IP and Kickstarter a few months before RTYI’s release to hire a larger team.
context_findings.quote: We’re gonna announce our own game project… and then I can hire a bunch of people.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is sceptical of Twitter yet uses it for thumbnail tests and upcoming marketing pushes.
context_findings.quote: There’s no point to Twitter fame because I can’t convert it into money—maybe I should start ramping up Twitter advertisement when the game gets closer to release.

biobak.summary: Provided new assets: cell-guy vendor, speed rings, airplane textures, random rock variants, and feedback on factory platforms.
Suggested making collapsing platforms fall immediately when Mario outruns them.
Offers professional translation skills for French (and coordinates with Rionno for Spanish).

zeina.summary: Animating all penguins and Dory to replace GeoBone-based rigs.
Was present off-screen during the stream; also cut Kaze’s hair.

key_stories.title: GeoBone Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Nintendo’s exporter duplicated animated bones, wasting a matrix multiply per actor.  Kaze removed the stop-gap system and must now re-animate affected models.
key_stories.challenge: Legacy GeoBone duplication hurt performance and complicated rigs.
key_stories.process: Explained bug history, removed workaround, flagged every old model for re-rigging.
key_stories.outcome: Lean runtime but backlog of animation work.
key_stories.key_quote: Instead you should fix it properly to save on a whole matrix multiplication per actor.

key_stories.title: Missing Propeller Crisis
key_stories.summary: The airplane lost its propeller because the texture was missing and wrongly formatted.  Kaze rebuilt it and debated IA8 vs IA4.
key_stories.challenge: Propeller texture gone, plane visually broken.
key_stories.process: Dug up old 32×32 texture, converted to IA8, clamped, fixed combiner.
key_stories.key_quote: We can’t just not have a propeller.

key_stories.title: Collapsing Platform Set Piece
key_stories.summary: Factory grates now collapse the moment a fast-moving Mario lands, creating a thrilling visual without raising failure rate.
key_stories.challenge: Make the section exciting but fair.
key_stories.process: Re-laid platforms, added instant-collapse logic, shake and sound cues.
key_stories.outcome: Intense, cinematic moment that testers can clear on first try.
key_stories.key_quote: I don’t want difficulty; I want excitement.

key_stories.title: Blender Exporter Roadblock
key_stories.summary: A Blender update broke the Mini N64 Object Exporter.  After troubleshooting, Kaze exported animation by hand.
key_stories.challenge: Tool produced only a static frame.
key_stories.process: Checked settings, tried armature overrides, concluded version mismatch.
key_stories.outcome: Manual export succeeded; long-term tooling fix still needed.
key_stories.key_quote: Surely there’s a reason it’s broken—what did I do to Blender?
